qas.question: What do cognitive neuroscientists believe memory is?

answers.text: the retention, reactivation, and reconstruction of the experience-independent internal representation

qas.question: What suggests that memory has two different components?
What showed that memory exists even before that memory is known to the person?

plausible_answers.text: the retention, reactivation, and reconstruction of the experience-independent internal representation

qas.question: What do regular scientists believe memory is?
What suggests that memory has three different components?

plausible_answers.text: the expression of memory at the behavioral or conscious level, and the underpinning physical neural changes
The latter component is also called engram or memory traces
others argue against this notion that memory does not exist until it is revealed in behavior or thought
